name: Tinapa Resort
address: Tinapa Free Zone & Resort, Adiabo, Calabar
description: A luxurious business and leisure resort featuring a massive shopping complex, entertainment center, and scenic waterfront.

name: Drill Ranch
description: Home to endangered Drill monkeys, this wildlife sanctuary supports conservation and offers an educational experience for visitors.

name: Slave History Museum
description: Located within Marina Resort, this museum offers a deep dive into Nigeria’s colonial and transatlantic slave trade history.

name: National Museum Calabar
description: Exhibiting artifacts from the Efik Kingdom, colonial rule, and Calabar’s cultural history, this museum is a must-see for history lovers.

name: Kwa Falls
description: A stunning natural waterfall cascading into a lush rainforest basin, ideal for hiking, picnicking, and swimming.

name: Millennium Park
description: A serene urban park with walkways, green spaces, and local art—perfect for relaxation and family outings.

name: Agbokim Waterfalls
description: A breathtaking seven-stream waterfall located in lush rainforest, perfect for eco-tourism, hiking, and nature photography.

name: Obudu Mountain Resort
description: Nestled on the Sankwala Mountains, this resort offers cable cars, mountain villas, and panoramic views of nature and adventure trails.
